item.title: Addictive Patterns
item.description: To get users to continue playing your game isn’t easy. That’s, why there are so-called addictive patterns. Addictive Patterns Addictive patterns in computer games can be important because they keep players engaged and coming back for more.

item.title: Analytics
item.description: For “A Journey of Music” there are a lot of ways to measure player behaviour, game hardness and game popularity. That’s, why we compiled a list of possible metrics we would like to use, to analyse our game.

item.title: Architecture
item.description: Game development is a complex and challenging process that requires careful planning and execution. One of the key aspects of game development is code architecture, which refers to the organization and structure of the code that powers the game.

item.title: Process of graphical design
item.description: Creating a 2D pixel character with LibreSprite can be a fun and rewarding experience. LibreSprite is a free, open-source software that provides a comprehensive set of tools to help you bring your characters to life.

item.description: Libre Sprite Parallax Maps are a popular way to create dynamic and immersive game environments. In this process, pre-existing maps are modified and enhanced to add depth and detail to the scene.

item.title: Sprite Animations
item.description: After a pause from blogging, we can announce, that we managed to have run our first sprite animations. As MonoGame is only a game framework and not a complete game engine, it means for us, that we had to do much from the ground up, on ourselves.

item.title: The software you need!
